DataElement.preferredName: Prior Biological Therapy Metastatic Administered Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator for administered previously treatment that implies the administration of substances which produce a biological reaction in the organism enhancing or restoring the host immune response, modifying the behavior of cancer cells, blocking the pathways of cell neoplastic transformation and tumor ability to metastasize, or facilitating the repairment of cells damaged by aggressive forms of cancer treatment for cancers that have spread from one part of the body to another.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to administered previously treatment that implies the administration of substances which produce a biological reaction in the organism enhancing or restoring the host immune response, modifying the behavior of cancer cells, blocking the pathways of cell neoplastic transformation and tumor ability to metastasize, or facilitating the repairment of cells damaged by aggressive forms of cancer treatment for cancers that have spread from one part of the body to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Biological therapy is a form of treatment that implies the administration of substances which produce a biological reaction in the organism enhancing or restoring the host immune response, modifying the behavior of cancer cells, blocking the pathways of cell neoplastic transformation and tumor ability to metastasize, or facilitating the repairment of cells damaged by aggressive forms of cancer treatment.  It includes the use of sera, antitoxins, vaccines, genes, cells, tissues, and organs

Concepts.definition: A type of treatment that uses substances derived from or made by living organisms to treat disease; this includes both naturally occurring and synthetic products.

Property.preferredDefinition: (MET-uh-STAT-ik) Having to do with metastasis, which is the spread of cancer from one part of the body to another.:Given.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior Biologic Thearpy for Metastatic or Recurrence

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received one biologic/targeted therapy for recurrent disease?
